New Records: India's 52 was the lowest score at which an individual player had brought up a half-century in T20Is where ball-by-ball data is available.
Key Match Events: Rohit Sharma scored 92 runs off 41 balls, including 76 runs in boundaries.
Arshdeep Singh took 3 wickets for 37 runs.
Kuldeep Yadav took 2 wickets for 24 runs.
Axar Patel's sensational catch on the boundary was a turning point in Australia's chase.
Hardik Pandya nailed three sixes in the final two overs to push the total past 200.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma's selflessness and commitment to an attacking game were highlighted.
Australia's hopes of making the final four now depend on Bangladesh beating Afghanistan.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India will play England in the second semi-final in Guyana after winning all three of their Super Eight games.
Weather conditions were sunny in St Lucia.
Australia needs Bangladesh to beat Afghanistan to have a chance to make the final four.
